bio.description: We bring innovative ideas to life
bio.name: DePaul iD Lab

posts.description: Had a great time at the KPMG US Chicago office for a case study workshop. Big thanks to Dwayne Prosko for leading such an insightful session.

We had an amazing opportunity to visit Microsoft with our AI summer camp students as part of an industry visit. David Giard hosted us with an engaging session on Empowering AI and demonstrated how tools like Microsoft Copilot can be used across various applications to make work easier and more efficient.

He also gave us a tour, showcasing advanced AI and AR technologies, including industrial applications. The students loved seeing real-world tech in action and learning directly from the source.

Thank you so much, David Giard, for making this visit so meaningful for all of us!

This week, we kicked off the Abbott Labs AI Summer Bootcamp for high school students at the iD Lab!
Our founder and Director of the iD Lab, Yele Adelakun, started the camp with an inspiring talk about what really matters when learning AI — not just the tools, but also teamwork, curiosity, and having fun along the way.
As students began working on the use case from Abbott and collaborating with our data scientists, they also got to hear from last year’s camp alumni, who shared how the experience sparked their interest in AI and helped build their confidence in solving real-world problems.
Huge thanks to Abhi Choudhary, Nik Umapathy, and Ndiana Obot for coming back to share about your journeys, your stories truly inspired this year’s group!

We recently had the pleasure of hosting Akhil Babu, Senior Design Researcher at IBM – India System Design Labs, for a deeply engaging workshop on Designing Business Through the Lens of Services and Systems.”

Akhil walked us through how service design can shape not just experiences, but entire business ecosystems. From understanding service touch-points and stakeholder relationships to rethinking the role of design in decision-making, the session went far beyond methods, it was about mindset.

What stood out most was his emphasis on slowing down, asking better questions, and designing for flow rather than just function. We walked away with new ways of framing value, future-facing project ideas, resources for continued learning, and most importantly, a renewed sense of purpose in how we design.

Thank you, Akhil Babu, for your generosity and depth. We can’t wait to apply what we’ve learned!

Get ready - ODi 2025 is happening on October 24th!

When projects line up and everyone is caught up in their own tasks, there’s one team that consistently goes above and beyond to keep us comfortable and supports us, they are our incredible management team - Aishwarya Rao Nagulavancha [ Client Relations Manager], Prashant Trivedi [Operations Manager], Shruti Srivastava [Head of UX & Research] and Manivarsh Adi [Head of Data Science]. Today, we proudly recognize these hardworking leaders whose dedication, passion, and behind the scenes effort make all the difference at the iD Lab. They truly deserve this appreciation and a special congratulations to each one of them on their graduation, your growth both professionally and academically, continues to inspire us all!

We had the pleasure of welcoming Don Fleschut, Chief Data Officer at Ryerson, for a visit to the iD Lab. It was a great opportunity for our members to connect, discuss data-driven innovation, and share what we're working on!

At iD Lab, we had a hands-on Power BI workshop where we learned to build dashboards, create reports, and visualize data.Thank you Uday Kiran Galla Srinivasalu, for leading the session and helping us strengthen our skills!

Last week, the iD Lab had the pleasure of hosting our annual CIO Luncheon at Baker McKenzie, bringing together tech leaders and lawyers for a powerful discussion on how artificial intelligence is reshaping the legal landscape.
The conversation explored both the exciting opportunities and the unique challenges of AI, today and in the future. A big thank you to our esteemed panelists Peter George, Alex Crowley, and Brandon Brooks, and moderator Yele Adelakun, whose expertise made the session truly impactful. We also appreciate Baker McKenzie for their generous hospitality and to all our partners who helped make this event a success.

We are so proud of your achievements, and incredibly grateful for your contributions to the iD Lab. Wishing you all the best in your next chapter!

Member Spotlight: Meet Shruti Srivastava. She is our amazing Head of UX and Research at the lab, while pursuing an MS in Human-Computer Interaction at DePaul University. Here is what she has to say about working at the iD Lab:
How did the experience at the iD Lab shape your perspectives and aspirations?
"When I joined iD Lab in August 2023, I was at a crossroads. Having worked for 7 yrs before coming to DePaul, I missed the fast-paced collaboration, structured teamwork, and sense of ownership that comes with an industry setting. But the lab became my space to lead, innovate, and challenge myself beyond what I thought was possible. More than anything, it has given me a platform to drive meaningful change not just through design, but also developing a system."
What made the relationships at the lab special to you?
"It’s rare to find a workspace where professional relationships evolve into something deeper. At iD Lab, we’ve built something beyond just teamwork—we’ve built a family. We celebrate the wins, no matter how small. We push each other to do better. We’ve had long work sessions that turned into dinner plans, debates over design choices that led to inside jokes, and stressful deadlines that became stories we now laugh about. It’s a home away from home, a space where we’ve grown together and built something truly special."
How did you navigate the balance between the academic environment of a university setting and real-world demands of clients?
"Coming from an industry background, adapting to academia wasn’t easy. The structure, pace, and expectations were different, and at times, I struggled to see how a second master’s degree would truly impact my career. But it gave me the space to explore, experiment, and refine my craft in ways that industry sometimes doesn’t allow. At the same time, working with real clients in the lab kept me grounded in the practical realities of UX—managing stakeholder expectations, designing for scalability, and solving problems that don’t have textbook answers. Balancing both worlds isn’t always seamless, but the lab has taught me to navigate complexity with confidence and embrace every challenge as an opportunity to grow."

We’re incredibly grateful to have Shruti as part of the iD Lab family! 💙

Meet industry experts Steve Park, Megan Sepper, Ben Rodrawangpai, and Witawat Daungjaiboon and learn more about ULSE’s impactful work and how you can get involved. Don’t miss this chance to grow your network, set yourself apart, and contribute with your vision!

Open to DePaul students only. Save the date and see you there!

Integrating AI for Strategic Advantage: Insights from the ODi Conference Panel Discussion

At the recent ODi Conference hosted by the iD Lab, we were honored to have Tim Dickson, Satyakam Pandey, Will Hansmann, and Neal Sample share their expertise on how AI is transforming industries, driving innovation, and reshaping business strategies. This compelling conversation was skillfully moderated by Patrick Emmons.

💡 Key Highlights:

🟦 Rational Intelligence: Breaking down systems to enable understanding, thinking, and creating, along with advancements in machine learning and data mining over the last two decades.
🟦 AI Policies and Education: Tackling challenges in implementing AI by creating comprehensive policies, educating teams, and aligning strategies across organizations.
🟦 Proving Business Value: Demonstrating the impact of AI through use cases, leveraging existing KPIs to derive actionable insights and develop new concepts.
🟦 Personalized Change Management: Addressing resistance to change by making transitions relatable and actionable, emphasizing the importance of personalizing the journey for individuals and teams.

At iD Lab, we are committed to facilitating conversations that push boundaries and inspire the next wave of innovation.

💬 What are your thoughts on integrating AI into business strategies? Let us know below!

#Innovation #ArtificialIntelligence #GenAI #ChangeManagement #ODi2024

🚀 Fireside Chat with Neal Sample: Designing an Intelligent Future

At the ODi Conference, we had the honor of hosting a compelling Fireside Chat featuring Neal Sample, CIO at Walgreens Boots Alliance, a visionary technologist dedicated to driving innovation and elevating digital experiences for customers and patients. Moderated by the brilliant Yele Adelakun, the discussion explored "Designing an Intelligent Future".

Key Highlights:
🔵 Balanced Approach: Neal emphasized the 20/80 principle, where 20% of efforts are focused on innovation exploring forward-thinking ideas and 80% on operational excellence to ensure reliability and scalability.

🔵 Sourcing Ideas: He explained how ideas for innovation stem from trends, consumer needs, and a forward-looking mindset. By asking, "What can we adopt or adapt to create impact?", organizations can prioritize meaningful and relevant solutions.

🔵 Bringing Ideas to Life: Neal highlighted how the approach varies based on the type, scale, cost, and risk of each initiative. As a test-and-learn organization, decisions are made dynamically, with some projects handled internally to maximize impact.

This Fireside Chat was a masterclass in balancing innovation with operations to build a future-ready digital landscape. Thank you, Neal and Yele, for sharing your expertise and sparking ideas for what’s next!

#ODi2024 #FiresideChat #Innovation #DigitalTransformation #iDLab

Event Recap:  ODi '24 Panel Discussion on AI in action at iD Lab

We were proud to host a panel discussion at ODi '24 on "AI in action at iD Lab" featuring our own experts and collaborators. The session focused on how innovation and strategic partnerships are driving impactful solutions in AI and safety standards.

Key Takeaways:
💡 Steve Park, Program Manager at UL Standards & Engagement, provided an overview of how UL addresses safety gaps in emerging technologies that lack adequate standards. He shared how UL collaborates with iD Lab to speed up the traditionally time-consuming process of researching market trends and consumer needs. Through this partnership, both teams identified their unique challenges and strengths, which allowed them to co-develop a solution that enhances research efficiency and ensures safety for users of new technologies.

💡 Akbar Aidarov, Senior Data Scientist at DePaul iD Lab, emphasized the value of collaborations between large organizations and universities. He shared how the team initially focused on producing reports but quickly identified an opportunity to develop a dynamic solution. By leveraging their strengths, they created a scalable system that accelerates research and supports UL's long-term goals, enabling faster and more informed decision-making for safety standards.

💡 Luke Agnew, Data Scientist at DePaul iD Lab, provided insights into the technical approach taken during the collaboration. The team gathered and analyzed data from hundreds of diverse sources, including news outlets, research publications, and consulting reports. By leveraging advanced AI methods, they developed a solution that extracts relevant insights tailored to UL’s business needs. To ensure accessibility, they also implemented an interactive interface that allows users to retrieve actionable insights efficiently.

The partnership addressed key areas like battery technology, clean energy, renewable energy, and human health, demonstrating the power of AI to solve complex, real-world challenges.

🎙️ Moderator:
Dwayne Prosko, Managing Director, KPMG US
With his insightful moderation, Dwayne elevated the panel, fostering an engaging and thought-provoking dialogue that resonated with the audience.

This discussion was a testament to the transformative potential of academia-industry partnerships in advancing safety, sustainability, and innovation.

#AIInnovation #ODi24 #SafetyStandards #Collaboration

🔍 Fireside Insights at the ODi Conference: Perfectionism is Not Your Innovation Friend” with Greg Chasson

We had the privilege of hosting Greg Chasson for a powerful fireside chat at the iD Lab during the ODi Conference. With his unique perspective on perfectionism, Greg shared invaluable insights on how excessive expectations can hinder innovation and personal growth.

Notable takeaways from this engaging session::

The Nuances of Perfectionism
Greg opened with a candid reminder that none of us are perfect—including himself. He emphasized that while people often view perfectionism as helpful, it’s distinct from setting high expectations. Excessive perfectionism, combined with rigid thinking, can be a recipe for disaster, as it often traps us in a box where we’re too afraid to take action. Quality doesn’t have to be sacrificed to avoid perfectionism; rather, it’s about staying agile and focused on progress over flawless outcomes.

Advice for Young Professionals
When asked about advice for young professionals, Greg encouraged a shift in mindset. Perfectionism and imposter syndrome often go hand-in-hand,” he explained, emphasizing that the real key to success is agility. By embracing experimentation, we can build momentum, take risks, and grow. Perfectionism, he said, is a paralyzing agent, and overcoming it requires accepting mistakes as part of the journey forward.

Measuring Success in Innovation
According to Greg, success in innovation is best measured by our willingness to take risks and evaluate results from a behavioral perspective. True innovation means testing boundaries and moving forward even in the face of uncertainty.

Overcoming the Fear of Failure
Anxiety is just an emotion,” Greg noted, reminding us that it’s within our control to approach our fears instead of letting them hold us back. By choosing to face fears directly, we build resilience and open up new pathways for growth.

Following the chat, attendees also had the chance to meet Greg for a signing of his book, Flawed: Why Perfectionism is a Challenge for Management.

The fireside chat was expertly moderated by Mike Krajecki, Partner at KPMG US and a proud DePaul alum, who shared his own valuable insights on navigating leadership challenges in today’s dynamic landscape.

#ODiConference #Perfectionism #Innovation #FiresideChat

💡 Shaping the Future of Responsible AI: Insights from Our Latest ODi Conference Panel Discussion

The iD Lab was thrilled to host a powerful panel discussion on "Designing Responsible AI with Humans" at the recent ODi conference! A huge thank you to our distinguished panelists - JoEllen Kames, Thomas Antony and Michal Janicki - who offered deep insights, moderated skillfully by Stella Sarbalieva, UX Manager at Deloitte.

Here are some of the valuable insights they shared:

🔹 The Power of Storytelling & Setting Expectations
 Every impactful AI initiative starts with a story. Our panel emphasized the importance of setting expectations early, agreeing on tools and methodologies to shape projects responsibly. Understanding these foundations can transform an abstract idea into a concrete journey.

🔹 Focus on Core Skills: Design Thinking & Small Projects
 For students and aspiring designers, it’s not always about learning something new; sometimes, it’s about refining what you already know. Skills like design thinking and hands-on projects are key in building a sustainable approach to AI.

🔹 From Idea to Business Case: The AI Journey
 Building responsible AI isn’t just about the initial idea. Our experts highlighted the importance of shaping a business case, crafting a narrative, and testing a prototype. This structured approach transforms abstract AI ideas into solutions that truly resonate with users.

🔹 The Evolving Role of Designers in an AI-driven World
 AI’s growth brings new challenges and exciting changes for design roles. As we move forward, designers will find themselves at the intersection of technology, ethics, and user experience, responsible for not only creating but guiding AI systems that prioritize human values.

We’re excited to see how these ideas will shape the future of AI.

#ResponsibleAI #UXDesign #DesignThinking #ODiConference #FutureOfDesign

🌟 Reflecting on a Successful Panel at the ODi Conference!

We are thrilled to share a highlight from the recent ODi conference hosted by the iD Lab in discussion with our industry experts Colin Boyle, Derrick Higgins, Ali B. and Marc DeMoss engaged in a dynamic conversation on "Overcoming Challenges in Enterprise AI."

💬 Highlights from the Discussion:

Governance in AI Adoption: Building a clear governance policy is essential for AI success. Effective governance provides organizations with clear expectations on securing AI models and managing parameters responsibly. This structured approach helps maintain a "macro" perspective, ensuring AI deployment aligns with both organizational standards and broader ethical considerations.

Data Privacy Challenges Across Industries: In sectors like retail, banking, and insurance, protecting personal data (such as PII and PHI) remains critical as AI applications expand. The discussion emphasized the importance of cautious data handling in AI models, reinforcing the need for strict controls on data inputs, especially sensitive information like dates of birth and names.

Buy, Sell, or Build? Adopting new technologies often raises fundamental questions about whether to acquire existing solutions or develop custom AI in-house. It was highlighted that policies and contracts should be updated to match new technologies, ensuring governance stays relevant.

Regulatory Benefits of AI: From a consumer perspective, AI has the potential to enhance regulatory practices. For example, AI could offer insights into more effective marketing or pricing strategies for financial products, helping organizations better understand consumer needs while reinforcing data governance. AI-driven enhancements could improve transparency and trust across various regulatory frameworks.

Understanding Stakeholder Needs & Prioritizing Use Cases: When choosing which AI initiatives to prioritize, the group stressed the value of a hybrid model combining technical and business inputs to select use cases that align with stakeholder needs and achievable delivery timelines.

Evaluating AI Models: With many models available, determining the right fit requires a balanced approach. The discussion highlighted the role of vendor partnerships, understanding technical feasibility, and discerning which capabilities are best developed in-house vs. acquired.

A special thank you to Scott Wisniewski, for skillfully moderating this insightful discussion and guiding us through these critical topics. We’d also like to extend our gratitude to all attendees who contributed to making this event such a success.

#EnterpriseAI #DataPrivacy #Governance #ODi2024 #iDLab #Chicago

Panel Discussion Highlights: "Tactical Approach to Maximizing AI Opportunities" at the ODi Conference 2024.

We are thrilled to share the success of the first panel discussion held at the ODi Conference, hosted by the iD Lab. This engaging session brought together industry experts to explore strategies for maximizing AI opportunities in today’s evolving landscape.

🔹 Panelists:
Omar Shanti - Chief Technology Officer at HatchWorks AI
Kristen Walker - SVP, Product Management at Mintel
Kevin Wittmer - Chief IT Expert at Bosch Digital
Reza Rooholamini - Chief Scientific and AI Officer at CCC Intelligent Solutions

🔹 Key Discussion Points:
Evaluating AI Tools for Specific Use Cases: One common pitfall is choosing tools before fully understanding what the project requires. The experts recommended starting by defining your goals and workflows first, then picking the tools that best fit. This approach helps teams avoid relying on tech that might not serve their true needs.

Addressing Security and Privacy Concerns: With the increasing use of public data in AI applications, managing security and privacy responsibly was a key focus. Strategies like anonymization, secure data storage, and ongoing compliance monitoring were emphasized as essential practices to protect data integrity and foster trust in AI.

New Policies and Governance for AI: As AI becomes integral to business, many organizations are establishing policies and governance frameworks to promote ethical AI use. The session covered recent best practices for aligning AI development with regulatory standards and organizational values, including guidelines on data use, algorithm transparency, and cross-departmental collaboration to maintain ethical standards.

🔹Takeaways:
A Tactical Approach to Scaling AI: Start with strategy, then select tools to scale AI solutions effectively.
Commitment to Learning: Embrace continuous learning to keep pace with AI developments.
Collaborative Efforts: Foster teamwork across functions to drive meaningful, ethical AI success.

The session was expertly moderated by Paul Haisman, Chief Information Officer (CIO) at Rotary International. With a passion for leveraging technology to drive organizational growth, Paul brought insightful perspectives to the conversation, ensuring the session was both engaging and thought-provoking.

A huge thank you to all our panelists and attendees for making this discussion insightful and impactful.

#ODiConference #iDLab #PanelDiscussion #FutureOfAI

🎉 Proud to Present Our Latest Innovation at ODi 2024!

We’re thrilled to introduce our latest project at one of the booths at ODi 2024, aimed at making job classification smarter and more reliable for SOC.

🔍 What is SOC?
The Standard Occupational Classification (SOC) system standardizes how occupations are categorized, ensuring consistency across industries. It’s essential for labor market analysis, regulatory compliance, and workforce planning, helping organizations and agencies accurately classify job roles for applications like immigration, hiring, and economic policy.

🚨 The Problem:
Classification systems like SOC codes are constantly evolving, which makes it challenging to match job descriptions accurately. This can lead to issues like visa denials, compliance risks, and inefficiencies across industries that rely on precise categorization.

💡 The Solution: Hybrid AI-Powered Search with LLM Integration
Our approach combines keyword search with AI-driven semantic understanding to deliver more accurate results. Unlike traditional methods that only match specific words, our approach leverages a Large Language Model (LLM) to understand the context and meaning behind descriptions. The system ranks potential matches, and the LLM selects the best fit with a clear explanation, making the process both precise and transparent.

🌍 Broader Impact:
While we developed this solution to enhance SOC code classification, its potential applications are wide-reaching. From insurance policy coding to medical billing and beyond, any industry with complex classification systems can benefit from this approach. We’re helping make classification smarter, more consistent, and adaptable to changing needs.

This project wouldn’t have been possible without the hard work and dedication of our lab members. Their commitment to innovation and excellence continues to drive impactful solutions that make a difference across industries. Thank you for your outstanding work!

#AI #SOCcodes #Innovation #ODi2024

We were thrilled to have Terry Finch, Divisional VP of Digital Technology Services at Abbott join us as a keynote speaker at ODi 2024!

Terry’s talk highlighted how AI is fundamentally transforming the healthcare industry by enhancing productivity, accelerating time to market, and delivering personalized, responsive, and accessible care. His insights on AI-driven innovations underscore the profound impact of technology on improving patient experiences and outcomes.

Key Highlights:

• Leading with value: Focus on the digital core, data, responsible AI, and talent.

• Innovating responsibly: AI for access, affordability, and secure solutions.

• Enterprise-wide AI adoption: From content creation to strategic planning and forecasting.

Terry also emphasized Abbott's commitment to Sustainability in everything we do,” reinforcing how innovation and responsibility go hand in hand as we shape the future of healthcare.

A big thank you to Terry and the Abbott team for their time, expertise, and continued partnership. We look forward to more collaborations in driving sustainable, AI-driven solutions forward.

#ODi2024 #Innovation #AIHealthcare #Abbott #ResponsibleAI #iDLab
